Package fileSystems

Class FileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • fileSystems.FileSystem
  • public class FileSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    The FileSystem instance is responsible for managing the relationship between the directories and files. It also provides the ability to navigate between directories.
    Author:
    Xuezhi Yan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      FileSystem()
      The FileSystem constructor takes no parameters, it initializes itself with a new starting path, a new root directory and initializes the currentDirectory to its root directory.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean addFileAtCurrentDirectory​(File fileIn)
      Add file at the current directory
      boolean createDirRelative​(Path path, java.lang.String dest)
      Create a new directory in the relative path.
      boolean createDirWhole​(Path path, java.lang.String dest)
      Create a new directory in the global path.
      boolean createDirWithin​(java.lang.String dest)
      Create a new directory within the working directory.
      boolean echoToFile​(java.lang.String nameIn, java.lang.String dataIn, boolean append)
      If append is true, append dataIn to the data stored in the file nameIn within the current working directory, create a new file and add the data if such file doesn't exist.
      boolean echoToFileRelative​(Path path, java.lang.String nameIn, java.lang.String dataIn, boolean append)
      If append is true, append dataIn to the data stored in the file nameIn in the relative path, create a new file and add the data if such file doesn't exist.

      If append is true, append dataIn to the data stored in the file nameIn in the global path, create a new file and add the data if such file doesn't exist.

      • echoToFile

        public boolean echoToFile​(java.lang.String nameIn,
                          java.lang.String dataIn,
                          boolean append)
        If append is true, append dataIn to the data stored in the file nameIn within the current working directory, create a new file and add the data if such file doesn't exist. Otherwise, rewrite the data instead.
        Parameters:
        nameIn - the name of the file
        dataIn - the data to append/rewrite
        append - true if append, false if overwrite
        Returns:
        true if successfully executed.

      • getFileInfo

        public java.lang.String getFileInfo​(java.lang.String nameIn)
        Return the data stored in the file under the current working directory.
        Parameters:
        nameIn - the name of the target file
        Returns:
        the data if found, null if the file is not found

      • echoToFileWhole

        public boolean echoToFileWhole​(Path path,
                               java.lang.String nameIn,
                               java.lang.String dataIn,
                               boolean append)
        If append is true, append dataIn to the data stored in the file nameIn in the global path, create a new file and add the data if such file doesn't exist. otherwise, rewrite the data instead.
        Parameters:
        path - the global path
        nameIn - the name of the file
        dataIn - the data to append/rewrite
        append - true if append, false if overwrite
        Returns:
        true if successfully executed.
